CONJUGATES: unfairly (adv) | unfairness (n) | more unfair (comp) | most unfair (sup)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English unfaier, combining the prefix un- (not) and the adjective fair (just, equitable, beautiful, clean).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not right or equitable; not in accordance with justice or accepted standards of behavior.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 不公正的；不公平的；违反正义或公认行为标准的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It was unfair to judge his performance based on just one mistake.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 仅仅根据一个错误就评价他的表现是不公平的。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Giving one side an unauthorized or disproportionate advantage in a competition, transaction, or negotiation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （在竞争、交易或谈判中）给予一方不应有的或过度的优势。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The company was accused of engaging in unfair business practices to eliminate competition.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该公司被指控从事不正当的商业行为以消除竞争。
